document.full_text: assisted suicide advocate jack kevorkian, who helped more than 130 people end their lives before spending eight years in prison, was "getting better" and was "not in grave danger" at a detroit-area hospital on friday, his attorney said.
document.title: assisted suicide advocate kevorkian "getting better"
lines_and_colors: assisted suicide advocate jack kevorkian, who helped more than 130 people end their lives before spending eight years in prison, was "getting better" and was "not in grave danger" at a detroit-area hospital on friday, his attorney said.
